column3: Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) shall have the right to renew the agreement after expiration of the 70-year period. 1 year prior to the expiration of the agreement, Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) may ask to renew the investment. This renewal can only be made once an approval has been obtained from the Government at the request of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, based upon the previous performance of Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) and according to the mutual agreement from the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries on the terms and conditions of the new contract.

column3: Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) shall pay the land fee annually according to the concessionary land rate defined by the Government and competent institutions. The fee shall be paid annually to the State budget through the account of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries no later than 31 January of each year. A 2% late fee will be charged monthly if there is delay in paying the fee. Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) agrees to pay the fee until the termination of the agreement.
column7: Redevances superficiaires//Surface fees
column8: Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) shall pay the land fee annually according to the concessionary land rate defined by the Government and competent institutions. The fee shall be paid annually to the State budget through the account of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries no later than 31 January of each year. A 2% late fee will be charged monthly if there is delay in paying the fee. Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) agrees to pay the fee until the termination of the agreement.--Arts. 4, 7.1

column3: If disputes arise during the execution of this agreement, the 2 parties shall mediate and settle the dispute based on the rights and obligations of each party to the agreement. If the parties cannot mediate or settle the dispute within 60 days, the dispute shall be submitted to the Council for the Development of Cambodia for mediation and reconciliation. If the dispute cannot be settled by the Council for the Development of Cambodia within 30 days, the parties shall send the files of the dispute to the competent court of the Kingdom of Cambodia for its decision according to the law in force.
column7: Arbitrage et règlement des différends//Arbitration and dispute resolution
column8: If disputes arise during the execution of this agreement, the 2 parties shall mediate and settle the dispute based on the rights and obligations of each party to the agreement. If the parties cannot mediate or settle the dispute within 60 days, the dispute shall be submitted to the Council for the Development of Cambodia for mediation and reconciliation. If the dispute cannot be settled by the Council for the Development of Cambodia within 30 days, the parties shall send the files of the dispute to the competent court of the Kingdom of Cambodia for its decision according to the law in force.--Art. 11

column7: Clause de stabilisation//Stabilization clause

column3: Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) is entitled to make a transfer to its successors. Legal successors refer to individuals who have been authorized by the law in force to inherit from Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia), or those individuals recognized by the law as its affinity. Notification on rights transfer or any decision regarding the handover to the successors shall be given to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries at least 6 months before the execution. If Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) transfers the agreement, the transfer shall be in accordance with the investment law of the Kingdom of Cambodia and have obtained the approval of the Council for the Development of Cambodia at the request of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries.
column7: Cession / transfert//Assignment / transfer
column8: Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) is entitled to make a transfer to its successors. Legal successors refer to individuals who have been authorized by the law in force to inherit from Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia), or those individuals recognized by the law as its affinity. Notification on rights transfer or any decision regarding the handover to the successors shall be given to the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries at least 6 months before the execution. If Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) transfers the agreement, the transfer shall be in accordance with the investment law of the Kingdom of Cambodia and have obtained the approval of the Council for the Development of Cambodia at the request of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries.--Art. 5

column3: If Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) faces a situation beyond its control, it has the right to withdraw from the whole project or part of the project, provided it has received approval for the withdrawal from the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries. If Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) withdraws without approval, it shall be held responsible according to the Investment Law of the Kingdom of Cambodia. If Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) fails to use its best effort to implement the activities set out in the agreement within 1 year starting from the completion of the survey specified in article 1.4, the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries shall have the right to terminate the agreement unconditionally and without compensation for damages. The deposit paid by Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) will also become State property.

column1: Clause de hardship ou force majeure
column3: "Force majeure" refers to fire, flood, storm, war, earthquake, civil unrest, insurgency, strike, explosion, epidemic and other events or circumstances beyond the control of the parties. If Global Agricultural Development (Cambodia) is not able to perform its duties in part or in whole pursuant to the terms and conditions of this agreement due to force majeure, it shall notify the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries in writing, specifying the reasons and its obligations shall be temporarily suspended during this period.
